datafield.subfield: Shelfmark: Ann Arbor, University of Michigan, Special Collections Library, Isl. Ms. 458
Origin: As appears in colophon on fol.300a, copied by Maḥmūd ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm. Finished copying in the year 750 [1349 or 1350].
Accompanying materials: a. Inventory cataloguing slip in hand of Winifred Smeaton Thomas.
Former shelfmark: From inner front cover, "IL 57 II" (likely supplied by Yahuda).

Binding: Pasteboards covered in red-brown leather ; Type II binding (with flap) though flap and lower cover are now missing ; upper cover carries stamped central mandorla (compare Déroche class. OAi2 7) and pendants ; pastedown of blue laid paper ; pasted label on spine bears former shelfmark ; sewing in light pink thread, four stations and worked chevron endbands in pale pink and blue over red leather core, damaged with only remnants of threads and exposed cores remaining (contribution to cataloguing from Aisha Wahab) ; overall in poor condition with lifting and losses of leather, upper board delaminating, sewing failing, etc ; repair to upper joint across part of spine in brown leather.
Support: non-European (likely Persian) laid paper; laid lines running horizontally and spaced roughly 7-8 laid lines per cm; heavy and flocculent with many undissolved fibers.
Decoration: Sūrah headings and Qurʼānic text rubricated; ink has faded in several places.

Script: Naskh; clear Turkish or Persianate hand in a medium line; mainly sans serif but with occasional serifs on lām of definite article, kāf mashqūqah preferred, pointing in strokes rather than distinct dots, curvilinear descenders, point of nūn set down within wide bowl (nearly encircled).
Layout: Written in 23 lines per page; frame-ruled.

Collation: V (10), V+1 (21), 6 V (81), IV+1 (90), 4 V (130), II+1 (135), 5 V (185), V+1 (196), VI (208), IV +1 (217), 8 V (297), I+1 (300); chiefly quinions; catchwords present; pagination in pencil, Western numerals (referenced in cataloguing).

Colophon: "Scribal," triangular, reads: "تم الربع الثالث من كتاب الكشاف عن تفسير الكلام الوهاب على يدي اضعف عباد الله جرما ... الراجي عفو ربه الكريم محمود بن عبد الرحمن بن علي بن عبد الكريم حامد الله تعالى ومصليا على نبيه وعلى اله الطيبين في سنة خمسين وسبعمائة والحمد لله اولا واخرا وله الحمد ظاهرا وباطنا والسلام"

Explicit: "عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم من قرى والصافات اعطي من الاجر عشر حسنات بعدد كل جني وشيطان وتباعدت عنه مردة الشيطان ويبرى من الشرك وشهد له حافظاه يوم القيامة انه كان مؤمنا بالمرسلين والحمد لله رب العالمين وهو حسبنا نعم المعين"
Incipit: "سورة مريم عليها السلام ثمان وسبعون اية ويروى [؟] تسع وتسعون ايات"
Third part of four from al-Zamakhsharī's celebrated commentary on the Qur'an, beginning with Sūrat Maryam (19) and ending with Sūrat al-Ṣāffāt (37)
Acquired in 1926 from the bookseller Isaac Benjamin S.E. Yahuda via purchase transacted on his behalf by Abraham Shalom Yahuda (1877-1951), his younger brother.

Several ownership marks on fol.1a, many obliterated, faded or incomplete ; gift / bequest statement on fol.1a, from Shaykh Muḥammad al-Tabrīzī via al-Ustādh ʻAmmār [ʻImād ?] al-Nashāʼī [?] to Ṭāhir ibn Shams [...?], satement reads "صار بحق الهبة من شيخ محمد التبريزي على يد الاتساذ عمار [عماد ؟] النشائي الى العبد الضعيف طاهر بن شمس [؟] المقرى [؟] ..." ; study note on fol.300a dated 971 (1563 or 4) in name of Jalāl al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh ʻUmar, reads "طالعه [؟] مع اكثر فوايده وحواشيه الفقير جلال الدين بن الشيخ عمر حسن [؟] ... غفر الله تعالى له امين ..." ; many fine examples of taḍbīb throughout for syntax clarification ; numerous glosses.
Maḥmūd ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn ʻAlī ibn ʻAbd al-Karīm,
محمود بن عبد الرحمن بن علي بن عبد الكريم,
